alert.note: Alert for Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 08 at 10:09PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...ACCUMULATING SNOW POSSIBLE FOR THE LOWLANDS OF POLK, YAMHILL, AND WESTERN WASHINGTON COUNTIES THURSDAY MORNING... Strengthening low pressure off the Oregon Coast will push a series of disturbances and frontal systems across western Oregon through Thursday, bringing periods of rain or wet snow to the region. Snow levels will generally be 1000 to 1500 feet through Thursday morning. However, cooler air trapped against the east slopes of the Coast Range will cause snow levels there to locally dip to around 500 feet or possibly lower. This increases the potential for accumulating snow in some of the towns near the east slopes of the Coast Range. Wet and slushy snow accumulations of up to 2 inches are possible Thursday morning down to the lowest elevations west of Banks, Forest Grove, McMinnville, and Monmouth. Any snow accumulations below 500 feet should melt off of most roads Thursday afternoon.

area.areaDesc: Central Willamette Valley; Greater Portland Metro Area
